image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Xiantao Shang went to an apartment seeking a woman who owed him money. When told she was not there, he and an accomplice forced their way in and assaulted the couple inside.

title.children: Canberra man avoids jail sentence over violent home invasion

image.altText: Disability car parks are behind fences with with no access signs on them.

props.synopsis: Patients with mobility issues are struggling to visit medical professionals after the Theatre Lane car park closed for the construction of the Lyric Theatre.

title.children: Disability parking closure leaves Canberra patients searching for options

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits in a living room looking serious.

props.synopsis: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

title.children: ACT voluntary assisted dying scheme begins, allowing Canberrans to 'die with dignity'

image.altText: A football player with long dark hair wearing a green jersey, surrounded by players from another team, looks over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

title.children: Police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: After a severe car accident, the victim spent a year recovering in hospital. Then one day he discovered his bank account was empty.

title.children: Man sentenced after emptying quadriplegic friend's bank account

image.altText: Leanne Castley in the Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

title.children: Silence from Canberra Liberals leader only making a bad situation worse

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouetted jetty and calm water.

props.synopsis: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it's either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity in long-term rentals.

title.children: 'The very best place in Australia' is running out of homes

image.altText: A street sign that reads "Wall St". A US flag is visible behind it.

props.synopsis: Last week the RBA governor issued a blunt warning on the state of financial markets and as markets continue to shift from traditional valuation methods, plenty of cool heads are getting nervous.

title.children: A key measure of stock market health is now flashing red

image.altText: GFX of Reserve Bank of Australia exterior laid over generic ASX images

props.synopsis: A Cup Day rate cut is widely expected to be off the agenda when the RBA board delivers its latest decision this afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA expected to keep interest rates on hold after inflation shock, ASX slips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX in the red ahead of RBA meeting
Market puts chance of RBA hold above 90%
Straker hits over 5-month high on European Union contract

image.altText: GettyImages-2244867148

props.synopsis: International horse Al Riffa has become the new favourite for the 2025 Melbourne Cup after persistent rain resulted in Flemington Racecourse being rated as a Soft 6. Follow live.

title.children: New Melbourne Cup favourite as rain continues to threaten at Flemington

image.altText: Police push back an angry crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: Dozens of demonstrators from Palestine Action Group rallied outside the Sydney International Convention Centre on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Thirteen arrested as pro-Palestinian protesters clash with police at defence expo

image.altText: A crowd of tourists taking photos outside Beijing Railway Station

props.synopsis: The extension, which is until the end of 2026, covers 32 European countries as well as Australia, New Zealand, Japan, South Korea and several nations in South America and the Gulf region.

title.children: China extends visa-free entry for 45 countries, including Australia

image.altText: NOLb_EskSolar_0211

props.synopsis: If solar panels at your property sustain hail damage, is there anything you can do to avoid further problems?

title.children: Giant hail left SEQ solar panels with gaping holes. Here's what you can do

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses with glitter up their cheekbones.

props.synopsis: For the LGBTQIA+ community, queer pubs and clubs can be an oasis. But in some capital cities they are vanishing.

title.children: By the end of the year, three capital cities will have no queer clubs

image.altText: Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest stands in front of the upside-down weir he has developed beneath the Ashburton River on Minderoo

props.synopsis: Mining billionaire Andrew Forrest's controversial plan to alter the natural river system on his large outback WA cattle station is under renewed legal scrutiny.

title.children: Billionaire Forrest begins fresh legal bid to alter sacred river in WA's north

image.altText: Diane Ladd in a blue jumpsuit pressing her hands on a Hollywood Walk of Fame star with her name, on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Diane Ladd, a three-time Academy Award nominee whose roles ranged from the brash waitress in Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore to the protective mother in Wild at Heart, has died at 89.

title.children: Diane Ladd, three-time Oscar nominee, dies aged 89

image.altText: Uncle Wayne is wearing a bright red shirt and white hat and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: "Discriminatory" changes to means testing in aged care could leave Stolen Generations survivors having to pay high fees for basic everyday services.

title.children: Stolen Generations elders worried about aged care reforms

image.altText: A feral pig stands near a trap.

props.synopsis: Neville Mattick says feral pigs are eating the lambs on his farm in the NSW Central West, with fewer than one in 100 surviving this season.

title.children: Feral pigs are eating 99 out of every 100 lambs on this NSW property

image.altText: Dust and debris falling on a cherry picker alongside an old brick building.

props.synopsis: One worker has been critically injured and another was trapped for hours after the tower collapsed while undergoing renovations.

title.children: 'Just started erupting': Medieval tower near Colosseum in Rome collapses

image.altText: A close-up photo of destruction to Afghanistan's Blue Mosque after an earthquake

props.synopsis: The centuries-old Blue Mosque site, one of Afghanistan's most revered religious landmarks, is a major gathering place during Islamic and cultural festivals.

title.children: Earthquake kills at least 20, damages Afghanistan's ancient Blue Mosque

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: In an email seen by the ABC, a US-based egg bank told IVF clinics it was introducing its new "Client Success Reward Program in Australia".

title.children: IVF 'reward' scheme proposed by egg and sperm bank sparks concern

image.altText: Dan Tehan and Angus Taylor

props.synopsis: The Coalition will gather this morning at a joint party room session as the issue of whether to keep or ditch its net zero commitment roils within the party.

title.children: Coalition to meet after Nationals lead charge to dump net zero

image.altText: A man wearing a black puffer jacket kneels down on sand on a beach looking at a dead sea creature.

props.synopsis: Ambiguous language in draft national environment laws means acting on scientific facts or not will come down to ministerial discretion.

title.children: Do new environment laws actually help the environment?

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair cheering a fire baton with two people dressed in white

props.synopsis: Charles Coste, who won Olympic gold in track cycling's team pursuit in London in 1948, left behind a sporting legacy.

title.children: World's oldest Olympic gold medallist dies, aged 101

image.altText: A beige funeral home with a red tile roof seen next to a black hearse and a yellow crime scene tape

props.synopsis: A US judge rejects a plea deal granting shorter jail sentences to funeral home owners accused of stashing nearly 190 decaying bodies in a bug-infested building.

title.children: Judge rejects plea deal for funeral home owners accused of dumping bodies

image.altText: A young Sudanese child with a bandage around their head is held by an adult.

props.synopsis: Reports from the Sudanese city of El-Fasher of mass killings, rapes and other violence "may constitute war crimes and crimes against humanity", the International Criminal Court has warned.

title.children: Reports of mass killings, rapes and starvation in Sudan

image.altText: A green, beige, blue and white map showing the location of Mount Yalung Ri in red next to Mount Everest and Kathmandu in black

props.synopsis: An avalanche on Mount Yalung Ri has killed five foreign climbers, whose nationalities are yet to be confirmed, and two Nepali guides, while at least five others were injured at the mountain's base camp.

title.children: Avalanche on Nepal mountain kills at least seven, officials say

image.altText: An artist's impression of a streetscape in a redeveloped Fishermans Bend.

props.synopsis: It has been touted as "Australia's largest urban renewal project" and is right next to one of the country's biggest CBDs. But critics say the development is being held back.

title.children: Fishermans Bend set to be 'biggest planning failure in Australia's history'

image.altText: Man smiles holding camera in ochre cave

props.synopsis: Will Jennings had been in Australia helping to survey bushfires from the sky for 11 days when he died. Two years on, his family wants answers.

title.children: Two years since 'entirely preventable' plane crash, this family wants answers

image.altText: A man looks at his award.

props.synopsis: From a dedicated doctor and a rubbish warrior, to a local hero who stopped a knife attack and helped fight Black Summer fires, the 2026 Northern Territory Australian of the Year awards are spotlighting local legends.

title.children: Doctor and dedicated volunteer named NT's Australian of the Year

image.altText: Close-up of an Indigenous woman with long, dark hair wearing a striped top.

props.synopsis: Police are offering a $1 million reward for information about the murder of a woman near the New South Wales-Queensland border more than 20 years ago.

title.children: Police offer $1m reward for information about cold case murder

image.altText: A boy does an activity at a table with his father.

props.synopsis: Liam used to dread walking through the school gates. Now, he can't wait to learn — but it took leaving a system that made him feel ignored to get there.

title.children: 'Terrible to watch': Why one family pulled their son from a Canberra public school

image.altText: A grainy CCTV image showing someone wearing black walk in a car park

props.synopsis: Police are investigating possible links between a man accused of a mass stabbing on an English train and a series of other incidents.

title.children: UK train stabbing suspect also charged over incident at London Tube station

image.altText: A blonde-haired caucasian man wearing a black suit and red tie makes a grumpy expression

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he felt badly for the British royal family after King Charles stripped his brother Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his title as prince amid mounting pressure over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump says pressure over Epstein scandal was 'terrible thing' for UK royals
